meanings.definition: A strap or cord used to support a plant or fruit.
meanings.sent1: The amentum helped the tomato plant grow upright.
meanings.sent2: She tied the amentum around the tree to prevent it from bending.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the amentum as a swing in the garden.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the amentum that kept him going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the amentum made it easy to spot in the garden.

meanings.definition: A bract that surrounds a flower cluster.
meanings.sent1: The amentum added a touch of color to the bouquet.
meanings.sent2: The florist carefully arranged the amentum around the roses.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten batted at the amentum, mistaking it for a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the amentum, surrounding everyone with joy.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals peeked out from behind the amentum, creating a beautiful contrast.

meanings.definition: A tuft of hairs at the base of some seeds.
meanings.sent1: The amentum on the seed helped it disperse in the wind.
meanings.sent2: Gently blowing on the dandelion revealed the amentum attached to the seed.
meanings.sent3: The amentum on the seed looked like a tiny crown, fit for a fairy queen.
meanings.sent4: The amentum on the seed was like a soft blanket, keeping it warm and protected.
meanings.sent5: Children love to blow on dandelions and watch the amentum float away in the breeze.
